channel.title: Hosting Issues (Rep ++ if you can help me)
channel.description:
Ok I have had continuous hosting issues for the server I am trying to release. So I am going to break it down bit by bit, and hope that this wonderful community can please help me with my problem that I have tried resolving for about a week now by myself.
I am trying to host my 562 server. I have done the following...
1. I have went to no-ip.com and made an account. 2. I have downloaded the DUC v3.0.4 3. I have made an ip for my server "fatalpkers.no-ip.biz" to be precise. <-- added to hosts and checked it in the DUC. 4. I went into my Linksys Cisco router -> Application and Gaming -> Port Range Forwarding (I'm pretty sure it goes here, but there is also Single Port Forwarding.) I added the title RSPS > External/ Internal Ports both 43594 > Protocol "Both" > To IP Address "My IPv4" > and Enabled, Saved. 5. I went into my source and changed the IP "127.0.0.1" to "fatalpkers.no-ip.biz" in the following files = ClientSettings.Java, Applet_Sub1, and ServersList. (There may be more but I have not managed to find anymore IP inputs.) 6. Compiled with no errors and ran my server. - AND STILL IT WILL NOT WORK. PLEASE HELP - I will be willing to Team View, but only to a trusted member. (Dealing with IP and such makes me nervous :p )
Please Help Me!

item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

iiLove, I have done all of that, its something with my port because when I check it it always says “connection timed out”

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep ++ if you can help me)
item.dc:creator: @iiLovePVP iiLovePVP
item.description:
@iiLovePVP wrote:

Listen To The Basic Steps:

  1. Change the IP Of Your Client To Your No-IP’s One.
  2. Compile, Zip, And Upload To File Hosting Website.
  3. Save The Link For Download.
  4. Change IP Of Client To Localhost.
  5. Turn No-IP DUC
  6. Run Your Server After Opening No-IP Duc.
  7. Leave Your Server On 24/7
  8. Send Me Link For Client I Will Check.
  9. Make Sure You Follow These Steps Correctly.
  10. If It Don’t Work Pm Me I Can Help You On Teamviewer.

This Should Work

Hope It Helps

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep ++ if you can help me)
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

The possible problems would be that

  1. Your client is still connecting to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

  2. You haven’t/didn’t portforward correctly

  3. Your no-ip host isn’t selected in the DUC

  4. Your firewall isn’t allowing people to connect

That’s about all I can do.

Read full topic
